summary: "The Godfather Part II" is a 1974 American crime movie directed by Francis Ford Coppola. It's based on Mario Puzo's novel and is both a sequel and prequel to the original "Godfather" film. The story follows two timelines: Michael Corleone (Al Pacino) protecting his family's business in 1958, and his father Vito's (Robert De Niro) rise to power from Sicily to New York. The film was a critical and commercial success, winning six Oscars, including Best Picture and Best Director. It's considered one of the best films ever made and was added to the U.S. National Film Registry in 1993.
title: The Godfather Part II
